Recipe.title: Stealth-Attack Chili
Recipe.Description:
This is one of the first recipes invented by Ransom. He wanted a good recipe that could be made with ingredients primarily from food storage. We went through several attempts, but once we succeeded, we would make it over and over. Due to the spices, it takes 4-5 bites before you realized it is very spicy hot. (Thus stealth-attack.)
Unfortunately, when we moved to Washington, nobody could stand how hot it was. (It's not that hot to me.) And when made for Boy Scout competitions, it didn't have a good "look" to it, so we invented Entrees / Stove Top: Klondike Chili. But, we still make this one from time to time.

section.instruction: Put water and beans in crock pot and cook them on Low overnight. (4-8 hours)
Drain all of the excess water, leaving beans in crock pot.
Brown Hamburger, until there is no pink meat left, then add to crock pot.
Put all other ingredients into crock pot, except water, and mix well.
Add Water until Chili is at desired consistency.
Cook on High for 2-4 hours or Low for 4-8 hours.

Notes.note: Dried beans are hard. They need to be softened before they can be eaten. That is why you have to start the recipe the night before.
People have different tastes for spiciness. Use the minimum if you like Mild. The max if you like Hot, or somewhere in between for a Medium.

Modifications.modification: May substitute 2 Onions cut into ¼" disks, then disks cut into 4 wedges for Dried Minced Onion.
May substitute 1 teaspoon Minced Garlic for the Garlic Powder.
May substitute 2 Tablespoons Light Corn Syrup for the Brown Sugar.
May substitute 2 14.5-oz. cans Diced Tomatoes for the Tomatoes.
This can be cooked on the stove in a large pot by substituting 3-4 cans of beans for the dried beans, then simmer on medium low for 15-30 minutes.
